website_summaries.verdict: Available in numerous storage options and easy to use. A few bugs that interfere with file transfers are possible.
pros: A compact flash drive by a recognizable brand
32 GB, 64 GB, 128 GB, and 256 GB options are available
cons: Failure to connect message for no apparent reasons sometimes occur
Issues with some photos not transferring have been noted

customer_reviews.title: If you like telemarketers and if you like peeping toms you will love this.
customer_reviews.text: Strongly dislike. You not only pay a premium for this external hard drive but also allow thieves, robbers and crooks into your iphone as noticed by the attached software agreement for the app to allow using this. It will upload certain unspecified data to the company and also let ads into your phone ad nauseum. Avoid like a plague.
customer_reviews.author: BUYER1

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work With iPhone X
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my iPhone X, plugged it in, but kept getting a "Failed to Connect" message. I got on SanDisk's online chat and after a half-dozen pointless (as it turned out) questions, the technician told me this was a known issue and to return it to Amazon for credit. Well, it works fine with my iPad Mini and with my wife's iPad Air so I'm going to keep it. I've been buying SanDisk products for as long as they've been around and this is the first time I've ever been disappointed. If you own an iPhone X, don't make the same mistake I did.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lansche

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and effective way to free up space on the iPhone.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and effective way to free up space on the iPhone. The purpose this was purchased for was to download just over 3000 photos from my wife's phone and not have to purchase more space on the cloud. Very easy to use, just plug it in and it has you download the mobile app then it asks to set up auto back-up feature. Very quick download speed which was a surprise. I was able to then remove it from the phone and plug into my laptop and transfer the photos and place them where I want.
customer_reviews.author: David Aguilar

customer_reviews.title: Useless product, save your money, this item stores NOTHING BUT 32GB OF HEADACHES
customer_reviews.text: Useless product, its caused me nothing but headaches since i got it (3 days now). It automatically deletes my files and chooses the ones to show me. I put my music and pictures on this drive and each time i plug it into my iPhone i get different songs and albums showing, it never shows all my music just random selections of them each time. As you can imagine its F**IN ANNOYING! to not know what songs are going to show each time you plug this stupid device in. Returning it tomorrow!
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: garbage
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. The designer didn't really figure the tight space you have to work in on different cases. With that said the connector that curves around from the USB connector to the iPhone connector will not bend without breaking. It also puts stress on your Phone if you don't line it up exactly right when putting it in or taking it out. Also, did not pull up the correct app when plugged in, it just gave numerous choices for different apps. Shop around before you buy this item.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great Item!
customer_reviews.text: I went the cheap route and bought a 16 Gig IPhone 6. Big Mistake!!! Now it is clogged with well over 2,000 pictures. With only a few other apps I was already running out of storage. Enter the SanDisk iXpand. I downloaded the free ap from the Apple Store, plugged in this flash drive and downloaded all my pictures to it. I set it up to automatically transfer any new pictures I've taken each time I plug this flash drive into my iPhone. It is small enough to keep in my purse should I need to retrieve some photos. Easy-peasy.
customer_reviews.author: Dragonfly

customer_reviews.title: Works for photo transfer but beware, slow performance unless you do this.....
customer_reviews.text: Tried it right out of the box and it was painfully SLOW to upload photos from iPhone. Minutes for each photo. What? So I Googled why and somebody said make sure your iPhone is not connected to ICloud. I disabled ICloud ( which I think is defaulted to ON) Go to settings then tap your profile at top of page. Then go down to ICloud and turn it OFF for photos. Once I did that photo transfer was fast, as expected. It's a little fragile so handle it with care.
customer_reviews.author: RICKVOO

customer_reviews.title: Poor execution
customer_reviews.text: Got this to test the ease of which I could send photos collected over the years to several family members and have them quickly and simply transfer them to their respective iPhones. I found the process to be confusing and not easy for most non-technical users to locate photos on the drive and move photos/videos to their phone. I purchased the Verbatim "Store 'n' Go driven found it extremely simple; I just ordered nine more.
customer_reviews.author: Bill S.

customer_reviews.title: Too slow to be useable
customer_reviews.text: So it does function - technically speaking. You can use it to copy/move things between an iDevice and whatever with relative ease. I don't really like the app, but it does what it needs to do - AT A SNAILS PACE! Seriously, it took nearly 2 hours to copy 1500 photos onto this thing. It took less than 5 min to import the exact same photos into my Mac directly using a cable. There is either something seriously wrong with the app, or with their implementation of the lightning connection. In a pinch, if you had absolutely nothing else, I suppose it's better than nothing. It's not good enough for me to keep though. Headed back to Amazon...
customer_reviews.author: The Mad Texan

customer_reviews.title: PRODUCT TO GET!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is completely AMAZING!!. It does an automatic photo and video backup or do it manually. I currently use an iPad Pro for school for school and so to save space or to give a friend class work, I use this ixpand drive to save PowerPoint's and Word documents. That was the a big plus for me...
customer_reviews.author: Mordy

customer_reviews.title: Read the negative reviews before you choose this product!
customer_reviews.text: Sounded promising, but although it works as advertised on a machine running Windows 10, it failed to operate correctly on my MacBook Pro. Initially, the drive opened and displayed its folders and contents, but the files copied from my iPhone 7 could not be viewed or copied. I renamed the drive on the MacBook and ejected it to try again on a laptop running Windows 10. There I found all of the folders and their contents readily available to view, copy, etc. Back to the MacBook to try again, but the drive will not mount, displaying an error message indicating the original disk cannot be found and a second when disconnecting it without ejecting it.
customer_reviews.author: Randy C

customer_reviews.title: Will not work with Tesla Dash cam
customer_reviews.text: I tried two and need to return both. Tried out of the box, quick formats, long formats and lots of little tricks but they will not work with My Tesla Model 3 dash cam. My original Sandisk drive does work as do 3 other random very old USB drives I have here with out any drama. I simply created the TeslaCam folder, plug them all in and they work instantly. I didn't even format them. The only thing I haven't tried is formatting on a Mac as I have no access to one (seemed to work for someone else?) I really wanted to be able to view my dash cam vids on my iPhone. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: MXracer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great - for 3 days.
customer_reviews.text: Great product in theory, but only theory. I love the idea of being able to transfer files outside the clunky iPhoto app using your computer. The only problem is it stopped working after 3 days and kept saying, failed to connect - try again. I trusted the brand name, so didn't try it right when I got it last month. Now I am stuck dealing with the company to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Bob

customer_reviews.title: Tesla User
customer_reviews.text: Needed for my Model 3. I had to format on an Apple for the drive to be recognized by the car. Works great now since formatting.
customer_reviews.author: SCSUguy27

customer_reviews.title: Backup and/or move data from your iPhone.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my 13 year old daughter who has an iPhone 6. She was able to make it work in no time, with no problems. Simple and easy to use. Now she can backup and/or move data from her phone to an Apple or Windows PC, or just leave it on the Flash Drive.
customer_reviews.author: independently minded concerned citizen

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: This isn’t a bad product but I gave it two stars because the app likes to randomly close when your listening to it. I got it for audiobooks I have and my computer is to old to update iTunes and install them that way. So figured this was a good way to go. But unless I leave the screen on with the app open it will just decide to shut down and I have to reload the app and remember what chapter I was in and how far along I was. I wouldn’t recommend this product for audiobooks. Files and music may be okay.
customer_reviews.author: Mercy

customer_reviews.title: This thing has solved my IPhone with PC issues!
customer_reviews.text: I was so tired of the difficulties of loading photos to my PC laptop from my IPhone. Always having trouble particularly with videos when connecting my phone to the PC and trying to transfer. Constant fight with it. This makes it easy. Just connect this to my IPhone, the Sandisk app opens immediately and saves all my photos and videos to it. Then, connect the sandisk to my PC thru a USB port and the windows photo app downloads the files to the appropriate folders. Works perfectly every time and no more fighting synch with the IPhone and Windows!
customer_reviews.author: Gutter Rock

customer_reviews.title: This works well for backing up you iphone during traveling ...
customer_reviews.text: This works well for backing up you iphone during traveling. The photos and videos uploads really fast. One of the problems is that the file it saves it as is a jumbled letters. I have to use a software on the computer to rename the files Advanced Renamer. That software works well so i can rename the file by time and even location. A weird quark that happened after IOS 11 update is that for all the photos that you take that is a live photo it saves the still photo but also saves the live photo as a video clip. Also because of the shape it doesn't work with all phone cases.
customer_reviews.author: Jlag

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to transfer photos from a PC to an iPad. I wasn't having too much success downloading a lot of old scanned photos into the iPad, and sending them as emails was tedious and slow. Per the microscopic directions on the back of the blister package, I plugged the iXpand Flash Drive into the iPad, downloaded the app, and followed the on-screen instructions. The control panels were intuitive, and the iXpand Flash Drive transferred photos seamlessly in both directions. It was about a 5 minute learning curve. I didn't purchase this drive to store and play content, so this rating is strictly for the device's ability to transfer files.
customer_reviews.author: Caveat Emptor

customer_reviews.title: Works decently
customer_reviews.text: Sandusky is kinda overcharging for the storage capacity here. But the device does work as advertised. You have to download their app to access the files on iPhone but after that it works.
customer_reviews.author: GBeezi

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have too many photos on my phone and I believed this to be the solution to my issues. Indowliaded the app. I though it was easy plugged in the usb drive and after a few pictures it twlls me it failled to back up. I unplugged it and closed down the app and began the process over. Again it tells me the same problem. It refuses to downlod and then the pictures will not all show up. Very disappointed and sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Pass
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't do what I want it to do... I easily downloaded the app and it seems to work great copying onto the flash drive from my iphone. The problem occurs when I go to view the photos on my computer. Over half of them show up as a .HEIC file and I cannot view it on my computer or save it elsewhere as a jpg. I also get duplicates of photos (assuming ones I've edited) and some I have deleted show up here even when I only downloaded from ones that were on my phone still (not deleted ones). Definitely easier ways to get photos off my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Katie S.

customer_reviews.title: Promising product, if you can get it to work :(
customer_reviews.text: I've spent a few days trying to make it work, but all I got was frustration. When copying photos to the flash drive, the Sandisk App for some reason creates all files using the same file name, and it basically overwrites the file copied before. So no matter how many files to select to copy, it will end up with only one. I contacted Sandisk, posted on their forum, but I haven't got any help yet. So my opinion on this product: Very promising product, if you can get it to work. It still need improvement.... I would not recommend it (yet)
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: Greatest invention
customer_reviews.text: Was tipped off to this device by a friend. It’s pretty much what I have always needed since I like to back my pictures up from my iPhone monthly. Easy as can be, you download the iXpand app, insert to phone via lightening end of device and follow the prompts. You are then asked if you want iXpand to delete all photos on phone device to clear space. Lastly, insert USB stick end of device into Laptop or desktop and transfer. Done!
customer_reviews.author: Ana F

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than a new phone!!
customer_reviews.text: I was ignorant of apps when I bought my iPhone and soon began running out of memory for photos. So, I bought this for a vacation I had planned so that I could download photos to this device. You load an app on your phone to manage the device. The app is probably pretty good, but I've been confused by it. Nevertheless, I was able to download lots of images to it every few days successfully. My biggest issue is that the photos lose their iPhone numbering system and get re-labeled on the device. I hate that. Maybe there is a way to preserve the iPhone numbering but I haven't figured that out yet.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Jones

customer_reviews.title: Simple and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: There are lots of other similar products at cheaper price out there but off brand just have too many issue (hardware/software) so decided to go with reliable name to try out this functionality. This is a very good product. The hardware seem to be good (time will tell how the bend will hold up) and fit iPhone even with case on. The software was easy to install and easy to use. Transfer photo from iPhone to PC without issue. So far transfer photo from 2 iPhones (about 1500 photos) and it work seemlessly. I really like the product. Did not use the auto backup functionality cause I want to be able to transfer only certain files.
customer_reviews.author: Normal consumer

customer_reviews.title: Finally I control my own pictures
customer_reviews.text: Finally I control my own pictures. Love this product. the only issue i had was that the Apple phones now use a HEIF and HEVC rather than just a JEPG or MOV format. If you have a PC with Windows 10 you will need to get the convertor program for 99 cents at the windows store. Or you can do some digging make sure your have the latest updates on your PC and can snag it for free. The only issues I had where not do to this product the product worked better than advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: I love this product
customer_reviews.text: My iphone has 8g space which is really rough now that the iOS update for the system takes up roughly 4g. iCloud doesn't quite do the trick either. PROS: This has become my best friend especially while traveling. I load this thing up with the photos, delete them off the phone and then the moment I get wifi, I back them up in the cloud. Love this thing. It's also quite durable. I'm pretty impressed by this product. CONS: the app can be clunky and isn't always smooth. I end up having to quit the app and then try again quite often. I would buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Mojdeh

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use once you set it up
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to transfer pictures and videos from my phone to my computer and have it organized before transferring but because the storage is only 32 GB it usually tells me there is not enough space even when it’s less than 10 minutes worth of video. It does work and after downloading the app and learning what to do it is easy to use. I have had mine for about a month and don’t use it at all just use airdrop instead.
customer_reviews.author: Mommy of 3

customer_reviews.title: It worked...but it takes some time.
customer_reviews.text: I first would like to say that this product DID work! I was able to transfer all photos and videos from my iPhone 6 plus to this device however it did take some work. I downloaded the app and connected the device without any problems but when I chose the option to move photos from the iPhone to the iexpand only 7 of 2000 moved over. I had to go in and manually add the rest which took a few hours because it take at least a minute for it to prepare the photos for transfer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great device! I truly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I am a collage student and I use my tablet for everything! All books and PowerPoints are on this tablet. Each academic year the tablet has less available memory, even thou I have everything also on a cloud, I can't rely on having everytime great internet to have fast access to all my files. Thanks to this I am able to move files in and out of the tablet with more ease.
customer_reviews.author: The Bio-Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Too many error situations.
customer_reviews.text: Works occasionally. Most used to add storage for music on my iPhone6. Start app and plug in disk - plays one or two songs and errors with a unsupported format. All the music is MP3. If I shut down the app and unplug, restart app and replug, one or two more songs and error. Don't if the problem is device or app? Only once have I been able to play music for an hour in car. Last night I attempted to RMA the disk. SanDisk want pictures of the disk attached to RMA. Stupid, jump thru hoops and get nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Morris W. Tate

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye iTunes!
customer_reviews.text: Downloaded the app, inserted the drive and was able to transfer songs, pictures, videos and ring tones from my Windows laptop in less time than it takes to add items to iTunes and click synch (while hoping it works and cursing about some of the file formats being rejected by iTunes). Lent this drive to family members and they were impressed. Bought another one for this years Gift Grab - I can already imagine this being the most grabbed gift! The only thing to improve for this portable device would be a cover or sleeve.
customer_reviews.author: Carnivore

customer_reviews.title: Easy to save photos but difficult to organize
customer_reviews.text: Plug it and it automaticaaly saves your photos. The problem is, it saves photos based on the date you captured the photo or screen shot. Not on the date that you actually saved it on this device. Which to me is inconvenient since i would need to find the photos in different dates or month or year in order to organize it. For example your friend airdropped you a photo which he took months ago, you need to find that photo on the date that he actually took it, not on the date that he airdropped it to you.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: It's only ok IMO
customer_reviews.text: I got this memory stick so I could clean up the space in my phone and transfer photos to my computer. It's only ok, in my opinion. The app or the stick is slow, not sure which and it sucks up my phone battery which is pretty frustrating. I can't rate it wonderfully, but I guess it does work as long as you have the patience and a good battery charge. I wouldn't really recommend it though.
customer_reviews.author: Fabiola Ferriz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent way to free up storage space and transfer files between devices!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after the uDrive I purchased less than a year ago quit working. This one is sturdier and remembers which photos and videos you have already saved and only saves the new ones. My only complaint is that I would like to see some sort of cap to protect the ends because I like to keep it in my purse. My solution is to keep it in an empty pill bottle. The app is pretty easy to use. I can easily save and transfer files from my iPad, iPhone and computer. My phone doesn't have much storage space, so this a life saver.
customer_reviews.author: Shari Brophy

customer_reviews.title: Lightning great - don’t use provided encryption software
customer_reviews.text: Awesome that it has a lightning connector - but the secure file feature is worthless and turns out to be totally unsupported by Sandisk. After using it for a week - it decided my password was wrong and the Sandisk support staff eventually admitted the software for encryption was third party and there was nothing they could do. No way to recover the files or change password. I just use Bitlocker now. But wasted money on iOS apps to use with the provided encryption software.
customer_reviews.author: ARLeggett

customer_reviews.title: Bought it to transfer files, found out it only backs up phone data.
customer_reviews.text: yep. I bought this to get around firewalls and transfer data from the internet onto a flash drive so that I could 3D print some wacky little inventions. Come to find out, it only backs up your photos and music....I think.... I wanted to save a file on the web, access said file with my iphone via safari, and save it to a flash drive that connects to my iphone. Well egg on my face. Good news is, I can now offload the million or so memes I have saved in my photos.
customer_reviews.author: Batfanatic

customer_reviews.title: Very handy
customer_reviews.text: Facilitates transfer of documents,music and anything between PCs and Apple products. Yes, there is sharing via syncing and the cloud, but especially when travelling I prefer to have what I need with me. I just wish they had a safe way to attach to a ring or clip, as I tend to misplace them.
customer_reviews.author: SPatUW

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I needed to view the pictures I had saved to my PC (Windows 7) on my iPad and iPhone. This thumb drive worked perfectly. I downloaded my pictures from my PC to the thumb drive using the USB connector and then was able to plug the lightning end into both my iPad and iPhone and view those pictures. I did not attempt to backup or download those pictures onto either the iPad or iPhone; I just needed to be able to view them. There is an app which you need to download from the App Store first, but it is super easy and fast. I highly recommend this thumb drive.
customer_reviews.author: AZ golfer

customer_reviews.title: Great for any Iphone
customer_reviews.text: I used it on an IPhone 6S then an IPhone 7 and now IPhone X, If you need to take pics out or put them into you IPhone this little USB drive to Lighting port will do the trick, make sure you download the app of this "external storage" and off you go. It transfer pics and videos in and out fast with out the need/help of a computer nor anything else. Plug and play. (After you download the app into your IPhone)
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: After 45 minutes of churning got a message like "0 files copied
customer_reviews.text: Simply didn't work on an iPhone 6 with current iOS. Installed app and tried to backup camera roll. After 45 minutes of churning got a message like "0 files copied. Some files were not copied. Try again later." Uninstalled app, shut down phone, restarted, re-installed app, same result. Sent message to tech support from within app. 48 hours later, no response. Item returned to Amazon and I'll now try the Olala iOS flash drive.
customer_reviews.author: OldJuan

customer_reviews.title: Not an Apple Guy but this works GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife as she is a Big Apple Gal, I'm more the Samsung type. Anyways we plugged this thing in and downloaded the app, let me tell you, it made transferring and downloading pics a breeze. I had a headache with Apples form of confusion and having to download all different things just to do one thing. Sorry again I'm not an apple guy so this helped make the world of a difference, I highly recommend it! No I wasn't paid to say this, wish I was though :D!!!
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: iPad Pro 12.9 Gen 2
customer_reviews.text: Update: Was able to get the unit to work after updating the IPad to the latest IOS. It’s simple if you want to download pictures and videos. It was a little tricky to get the PDFs or books but got it to work. The transfer speeds are pretty fast. Solid item.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gomes

customer_reviews.title: I am hoping when that happens there will be a easy update for this require device for operating systems not ...
customer_reviews.text: My entire house hold is Linux and chromebooks. The proprietary Apple phones do not give up the music and photos but this device will let Linux or Chromebook user get photos from a iPhone or iPad without resorting to a neighbor's possibly infected windows system, or an expensive MAC system. Works well keep one handy until Apple decides to change (IOS) operating systems again blocking the use of this type of device. I am hoping when that happens there will be a easy update for this require device for operating systems not in the main stream.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Not for me. Super slow.
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to be a great product. Well built, easy to set up, great idea. However,,,,,,. When I first plugged it in I did a test dump of about 15 average sized pictures from my phone to the flash drive. IT TOOK 2 HOURS!!! Curiosity grabbed me and I went bigger, 50 pics, after 3.5 hours went by I stopped it. I’m using an iPhone 7 Plus. All up to date. Should have had no issues. This will now sit in a basket full of other useless tech stuff I have.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Moore

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, auto back up features
customer_reviews.text: Trusted Sandisk to be the better from the lot and not disappointed. Their app is easy to use. You can setup back up and get your files to be automatically transferred to the device. Has been easy to use. The price is a little steep though compared to other options but those are subpar products. Go with a trusted name with these because its all about the app and you would want something thats easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: Good for iPhone 5, 6 & 7, not iPhone 10.
customer_reviews.text: I have been reading up about these drives for several months. I prefer SanDisk for my flash drives, so I read a lot of reviews before I bought this one. Unfortunately, it did NOT work for an iPhone 10 despite other reviewers claiming it did. I tried it on an iPhone 5, 6 and 7. It seemed to do best on a 6. The 7 was taking more than 2 hours to load videos and drained the battery. The curve of the cord is very awkward if you have a thick case (Otterbox was my issue) and I couldn't plug it in without taking off the case.
customer_reviews.author: Sara J. Whitlock

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This product is great for a number of reasons. Almost everybody uses their cell phone for a camera so you can load from the phone right to the stick. I use it for music. You can put like 2000 songs on one of these. So I can listen to what I want and not take up precious memory on my phone. You have to download the company’s file before you use it. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: M Bunero

customer_reviews.title: You don't need to be tech savvy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my father for his birthday so he can save pictures from his iPad onto it. I didn't realize that he had close to 30,000 pictures on there, so it took a while for the app to load his pictures. It appears as though you cannot move pictures directly, only copy them. It would be nice if it would automatically delete from the iPad when transferred to the drive. All in all, he likes it, and it was easy for him to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for IPhones. SanDisk is on top of it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for girlfriend that has to have iPhone. Solved problem of transferring everything from old phone to newer phone and backing it up without going through the cloud. I don't like putting anything out there with all the hacking going on. That is why we call all this stuff PC. Can download to an Android product easily but not back. This made it very simple. Have always been a SanDisk man for memory.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Not for Live Photos.
customer_reviews.text: It transferred my photos very easily from my iPhone 6. But, it doesn't transfer them in the live photo format. It transfers a photo and its accompanying video (the two parts that together make a live photo). So I have to decide if I want to not save as Live Photos by using this very easy to use device, or safe via some other application (Amazon photos, Photos on my iMac, etc).
customer_reviews.author: K. G. Holt

customer_reviews.title: No luck for me.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second flash drive I’ve bought to store my photos. The first one was horrible it took forever and it wasn’t easy to use. This flash drive takes forever and the app that is used for it crashes. I tried to use it on my laptop to see what was uploaded to it but it wouldn’t even show anything on my laptop it said flash drive was corrupted. So, once again, waste of money and time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hard to figure out the software and for some reason ...
customer_reviews.text: Hard to figure out the software and for some reason whenever it tries to automatically copy the photos on my iPad it also makes another copy of each or something on the iPad too and gums up all the memory and has to stop before getting many of the pictures copied. The reason I am trying to get them off the iPad is because there is no more space and it's filling up what little space is left? Why can't they just make something that will just get a copy of your photos plain and simple
customer_reviews.author: S. Birch

customer_reviews.title: Add great memory that is transferable and cheap!
customer_reviews.text: Finally, a terrific storage tool for iPhone and USB. This unique flash drive also allows you to use a camera button to store the photos and videos immediately on the flash drive when it is connected to the phone. Easy to set up folders for different photos or different users. I assume the price on this type of device will drop. My biggest complaint is the the Lightning plug just sets in a small rubber slot...it would be better if the whole flash drive had a rubber case (see the Leef Bridge 3 for such a cover). It needs some outer protection
customer_reviews.author: DocTheology

customer_reviews.title: Careful this device may make other card readers and adapters inoperable on the iPhone
customer_reviews.text: Once you install this device iXpand onto an iPhone 6 It will work BUT you will NOT EVER be able to use OTHER CARD READER in the future. All of my other card readers and adapters work well with my iPad but none of them are recognized by “files” app. And the iPad while recognizing other card readers and adapters won’t recognize the SanDisk ixpander
customer_reviews.author: Logical

customer_reviews.title: almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: I like the app and the drive itself. Very easy to use, and isn't bad looking. But the part that the lightning connector connects to is waaaaaaaaaay to weak, wore out on the third time clipping it in. Now the connector is just sort of hanging out. The clip should be made of with tougher plastic or metal.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Wang

customer_reviews.title: Great product, questionable design
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use at work to help transfer files between a computer and iPad. My biggest complaint is the design/shape of the drive. If using this with an iPad or iPhone with a bulky case you have to stretch this drive out and I believe will cause excess wear to the lightning connector on my device. Other than that it is a very handy drive.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Denesowicz

customer_reviews.title: Cheapest insurance for whatever you need to store
customer_reviews.text: Really one of the best purchases I’ve made as a high-schooler. Our school gives us our own laptops that we can back up on the network shares that they provide. I was skeptical of their network shares towards the end of the year so I bought this so I could have it on a flash drive AND on my iPhone. When we got our computers back they had removed everything on our network shares but no worries because I had this. The app is easy to use and I enjoy it because if I lose the flash drive, which I probably will, then it is backed up on my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use. Great to save all pictures and videos
customer_reviews.text: Great to keep my pictures and videos on so I can free up space on my iPad. Don’t have to decide which pictures to save and what to delete to gain back space on my small storage space on iPad. Hard to plug into my iPad. Feels like I will break the drive when I have to spread it open to plug in. App is handy. Wish I could back up more then pictures and videos. But that is on Apple to fix. Very handy to have. Have not tried to load a movie to watch while on the road but will try later.
customer_reviews.author: LFD159

customer_reviews.title: It just works.  So easy.
customer_reviews.text: Easy, Fast way to backup your iPhone. I always hated travelling with a laptop for the sole purpose of backing up the photos I took on my iPhone (and I was never in a place where I could use the iCloud to replicate the full images to another location). This is quite possibly the simplest product I've ever used - download the iOS app and plug in the Sandisk - it just works.
customer_reviews.author: hgpilot - MM

customer_reviews.title: Christmas Gift
customer_reviews.text: My sister was so excited that she received this. It helps out tremendously but she is a picture taker for sure! Need all the extra space one can get when it goes like this!
customer_reviews.author: Denise L.

customer_reviews.title: Useless on an Apple iPad Air
customer_reviews.text: Utterly useless on my iPad Air. The iPad Air is listed as a supported device, but the San Disk iXpand failed miserably for me. On the first attempt, it transferred about 500 photos then froze solid. On second attempt and thereafter, it simply did not function at all. I read the reviews before buying, and it appears to work for some people out there. I would not purchase this or any similar device, especially with proprietary, non-Apple software, in a million years.
customer_reviews.author: jcgsbg

customer_reviews.title: Works with the iXpand app
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to navigate the app. I don’t exactly like the design of the loop and the exposed ends. It would have been better if it was metal with a protection covering the usb and iPhone connector end. It works well even though I do not like the design of the drive.
customer_reviews.author: Caren

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t work for me. Plugged in the flash drive and the the phone recognized it, told me to download the app. After doing so, launched the app and accepted all the privacy notices. However, plugging the flash drive back into my phone, the phone would never recognize it. Returned to amazon.
customer_reviews.author: grahamgg

customer_reviews.title: Saved me the cost of a new iPhone
customer_reviews.text: I have a 16g iPhone and memory is always short. I bought this memory stick because I was going to Europe and would not always have access to wi-fi in order to upload my photos to the cloud. I took pictures at will and simply connect the flash drive to my phone to download them at the end of each day. When I got home, I loaded thousands of pictures from the flash drive to my computer and uploaded them to the cloud. This is a great solution to low phone memory.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: This screwed with my phone
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used it I left it plugged in for an hour and it didn't look like it had done anything except drain the battery. It never moved past backing up 2 of my photos. I tried it again the next day and same thing. Then apps on my phone started acting up (the icon would be there but not the name or vice versa.) I hadn't added any other apps or anything else to my phone besides use this flash drive + the app you need to use it. Don't waste your money on this look for a different one.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Perfect storage for Apple iPhone or iPad.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the most awesome products I have ever bought. I called Apple looking for external storage for iphone, ipad. Although they do not sell it or officially recommend it the kind guy at Apple customer service just said check this out. I did and bought a 128GB version. They are now available up to 256GB. We travel and don't always have wi-fi/cloud access. This is the PERFECT solution.
customer_reviews.author: Hal R

customer_reviews.title: This has helped clear my phone of photo's or video ...
customer_reviews.text: This has helped clear my phone of photo's or video. I will say if you have 3-4 thousand photos or a lot, it could take a long time. I waited to long to get everything off of my phone and this works but you need your phone fully charged and to get everything onto this could take a little bit of time. Works the way it should and is a solid product.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Easy and Quick To Use
customer_reviews.text: The app and hardware work great in conjunction with each other. The user interface was quite simple and ripping the files from the iPhone to the flash drive was extremely fast for the amount of data that was transferred. I'm on the fence about having another app having access to my data, but it's hard to argue with the ease at which the transfer took place.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Woody

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for quick backups
customer_reviews.text: Easy to connect and backup photos from the iPhone. Simple to transfer pictures to the Sandisk then to a portable SSD. Quickly transfers photos from the phone. Transferred 5k pics in a few minutes and able to remove the iOS iCloud warning about backup space and clear out the photos.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Game changer
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for keeping in check my phone storage. I use it specially when vacationing and it’s good to know that my treasured memories are safe in this backup storage unit
customer_reviews.author: Humberto Olivares

customer_reviews.title: does not do the job as promised
customer_reviews.text: did not do the work on my iphone 6s plus. first, the app which you need to install from app store seems to start copying files and then stops. it first freed up a lot of space on my iphone but pictures were not available on the stick. then the memory on the iphone started piling up again. returning the stick back
customer_reviews.author: Sergei H

customer_reviews.title: This worked like a charm in getting pictures off my phone
customer_reviews.text: This worked like a charm in getting pictures off my phone. It was almost too easy. I keep thinking that it has to be more complicated than that. Usually Apple locks down any kind of file movement outside their systems. Not with this device. If your phone is full of pictures and you don't have a PC or don't want to use the Cloud.....this is the product for you!
customer_reviews.author: K. Newcomb

customer_reviews.title: Design Flaw
customer_reviews.text: The lightning end of this USB stick does not tuck into place, leaving it exposed to the elements and more susceptible to damage. I wish they would just copy the design of Sandisk's USB/micro USB thumb drive that retracts on both ends.
customer_reviews.author: Rebootin' Rubin

customer_reviews.title: Saves all my memories
customer_reviews.text: You do have to install an app to use this on your phone. The app is so easy to use. Not to mention I can save phone space now. I had 5k photos I transferred over last week! I did transfer about 200 at a time because I didn’t want it to pause and start out again. I also enjoy the fact after I transfer the photos the app asks if I would like to delete those specific photos. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Peyton Martin

customer_reviews.title: Solved my problem of retrieving pictures from my iPhone.
customer_reviews.text: Made it easy to get photos off my previous iPhone that would not survive the switch from iTunes to iCloud (or so I thought). Rescued all the pictures from the phone, and via USB, transferred them to my computer and thence to our cloud storage/backup. Well made. I believe this could work well for an iPhone that is running out of space (for pictures or music).
customer_reviews.author: Carlick

customer_reviews.title: Cool USB to transfer files between iPhone and Laptop
customer_reviews.text: So I regularly use my iPhone to record videos for YouTube. I needed a way to transfer the photos and videos to my Macbook. I normally use Airdrop, but it's takes awhile to transfer. This USB stick really speeds up the process. You just plug this in your iPhone, open their iXpand Drive app, tap on Copy Files, and it lets you choose either to "Copy photos from iPhone" or "Copy files from iXpand Drive". It does transfer photos and videos pretty quick depending on the file size.
customer_reviews.author: Hoa

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work on my iPhone XS
customer_reviews.text: Does not work. Tried over and over to get it to work on my XS iPhone. The phone would not recognize this drive
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Not user friendly
customer_reviews.text: Did not like this product at all, tried several times to back up photos and when I try to open them it tells me file not supported and I can’t view any of my photos. Not user friendly at all, I’ll stick to Dropbox
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Cool new toy
customer_reviews.text: Not really a toy. It is very fast pulling those photos off the phone and ipad. Easy enough to pull pictures off the phone onto a computer with other devices but on vacation with just the phone this was great. Stores a lot of pictures. I love it. And you can't go wrong with San Disk
customer_reviews.author: GmaH in SC

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever!
customer_reviews.text: OMG this was the best purchase ever! I scrapbook and have trouble at the Kodak machines printing photos. Apparently those machines aren’t very compatible with Apple products. I read reviews and needed this photo printing process to be easier. I have a iPhone 6. It’s so easy to transfer photos from my phone to this flash drive and printing is a breeze! Highly recommend this wonderful product.
customer_reviews.author: ilovecats

customer_reviews.title: Changes file name and file type
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed as I was initially very excited about this product. 1) The app/device changes the file names when you transfer from iPhone to computer. What’s the point of changing the file name to something even more cryptic? 2) The file type changes to HEIC when transferring using this device. This does not happen when I transfer using a standard lightening cable - which retains the jpg. format. Not at all worth the hassle
customer_reviews.author: SM_chi

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: This works, it’s not user friendly in the least. It’s designed to manage photos from your iPhone, but not music. You can’t load music from your phone, only your computer using iTunes. I imagine you can use iTunes to load video too, I didn’t try it. When you play music from the flash drive, it’s user interface is okay, but it drops out when I remove both of my AirPods and has to reboot. Then it will continue to play, just not very handy.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: If you have a little patience would recommend
customer_reviews.text: It works well, I have a life prof case and had to order an extension for it, an extra $5-$10. I also had to download another app to watch movies because for some of them the sound just didn’t work, I would recommend the infuse app. Other than the hour it took to “configure the data” I really enjoy having all my pictures, movies and back ups in a little flash drive that can transfer computers easily. It’s a neat little device that I would recommend for anyone that has a little patience and time to get it started.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Important tool for my job.
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have USB for any iPhone users. Makes transferring files, photos and video so much easy. I work for an apartment complex and when I’m out walking the property I can easy take photos for repairs or completed work with my phone and transfer them to my computer so easy. I have one to my boss as a Christmas gift and she loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: The worst item purchased
customer_reviews.text: The worst item purchased. I kept getting error messages during backup and when copying photos from iPhone to iXpand flash. The process was so slow and took forever.. I had to disconnect the flash from my iPhone multiple times and still was not able to backup nor copy my entire photos. I have many regular SanDisk flash drives for PC and they are good but this was very poor product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: iPhone 6s and iPhone 6 backups
customer_reviews.text: Used to backup both my and my wife’s iPhones. Worked like a charm on both. Did not keep the same file names however, renamed to digital file names. Nor does it list the files by date but the date meta tags retained correct info. Works for me!
customer_reviews.author: Vat

customer_reviews.title: Looks good
customer_reviews.text: I can’t say how this works. I bought it for my GF for Christmas because she had so many photos on her phone, she’s used up all the phones memory. I copied all the pictures to her laptop so she could install the app and use the stick. But she hasn’t cleaned the photos off her phone. So I copied the photos a second time. She still has not removed them from her phone. She just wants to complain about how there is no room on her phone, then deal with fixing it. The product looks nice though.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher McCartney

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad. App needs a makeover.
customer_reviews.text: The product is very useful for media usage, especially with the “TopReel”. The Backup Software for Storage tracking is not only slow but totally UnFriendly. Needs a makeover to “iKlips” App. If the link to TopReel doesn’t load. Quickly copy the Address Bar & u shall find the code at the end of the URL. ON AN OVERALL It’s a good device if iKlips wasn’t as expensive.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Update on my previous review
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in May and would use it periodically to back up my pictures. Now that I have a new phone, it has stopped working completely and will not back up my files. Very disappointed and if I could return it, I would but now I know that these will not last long at all.
customer_reviews.author: Hildie

customer_reviews.title: Not useful
customer_reviews.text: The ONLY thing that you can transfer from an iPad to the jump drive is pictures. No movies. No apps. No music. So unless you take a ton of pictures with the iPad this jump drive is useless. Also while you can convert movies to the jump drive they lag when you attempt to watch them on the ipad. Using iPad 6th generation.
customer_reviews.author: MaryLou

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Thought this was the answer to my iphoto problem but NOT. It only downloaded half my pics and wouldn't take anymore even though there was plenty of room left on it. Very strange. And I couldn't even figure out which of the 1000s were downloaded so i could delete them and try again. Very disappointed. I would return it but it's too much trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Captive in Florida

customer_reviews.title: Thought it would make my life easier...
customer_reviews.text: When I got this product, I truly thought it was going to be a major fix to the issues I have with my phone. I plugged it in, downloaded the app, tried to copy my files and it just crashed. And it continues to crash, in fact I really haven't been able to copy more than 500 pictures without it crashing, pictures I have to go back on my iPhone and delete manually because the app never makes it to the point where it asks me if I want to delete the pictures off my phone and actually.... I don't know? Make space on my phone? ugh. SO frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Works great, though admittedly the design worries me only because I’m clumsy and think that I’m likely to snap the phone port. It’s been a life saver on working on word documents on the go as I don’t have WiFi and my hotspot never functions.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Murph

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to use this to back up the photos on my iPhone 6. Unfortunately, it is taking so long to complete a backup that my phone's battery dies before even 1 backup has completed. I wasted my money on this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Niki Shields

customer_reviews.title: Flash drive for photos
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed. I was able to take all my photos off my phone but they are all together on this flash drive. Don't need to worry about loosing my photos especially if I accidentally lost my phone or something happens to my phone.
customer_reviews.author: A. Katherine

customer_reviews.title: ... to get as many pics as I would have liked and now have a product I can't use
customer_reviews.text: In the middle of my trip the part that goes into the phone broke off/came out so I wasn't able to get as many pics as I would have liked and now have a product I can't use. Silver lining is I was at least able to get the pics off the bigger part but just spent my $ on something that lasted 3 days
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Only works with pictures, nothing else despite claims
customer_reviews.text: Beware: Doesn’t work with “other files” like the video in the description says and that’s why I bought it: no Word docs, excel files, PDF, etc. Which is sad because that’s why I bought it. Only works for pictures, music, and videos (videos have size limitations). Also doesn’t work with iOS 11 native files app.
customer_reviews.author: BootlegBrewer

customer_reviews.title: Great to store photos from your iPhone
customer_reviews.text: Love this gizmo. Would have even better if it came with its own case. Had to use a lighter case to place it in. Have not used to capacity. All my photos from iPhone have been stored on this. Love it. Recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Donatella

product_meta.title: SanDisk 32GB iXpand Flash Drive for iPhone and iPad - SDIX30C-032G-GN6NN,Black
product_meta.description: Size:32GB| Style:Loop StyleThe perfect companion for your iPhone, the iXpand Flash Drive lets you free up space on your iPhone, back up your camera roll, and even watch videos straight from the drive4. The flexible Lightning connector works with most cases and the USB 3.0 connector plugs into your Mac computer or PC, making file transfers quick and easy. The drive also includes password-protection software to keep your sensitive files secure across your devices5. Take all the photos and videos you want-with the iXpand Flash Drive you're always ready to take more.
feature_bullets: Designed with a flexible connector to fit through most iPhone cases
Automatically back up photos and videos from your camera, contacts

Quickly free up space on your iPhone (iPhone 5, iPhone 5c, iPhone 5s, iPhone 6, iPhone 6 Plus, iPhone 6s, iPhone 6s Plus, iPhone SE, iPad Air, iPad mini, iPad mini 4, iPad Pro 12.9", iPad Pro 9.7" iPad with Retina display, iPod 5th Generation and newer, with Lightning connector and iOS 8.2+)
High-speed USB 3.0 transfer to and from your computer. Operating temperature: 0-35 °C functional
Easily manage your photos and videos with the iXpand Drive app. Support for . WMV, .AVI, .MKV, .MP4, .MOV video formats

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars3,840 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
